result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) and Operating w/ PAC (3rd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (3rd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Scott D Kistner was found guilty of OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine and costs payable as follows:   $100.00 per month starting December 1, 2015 and on the same day thereafter until paid in full.    Failure to pay any part of the fine and court costs will result in 30 days jail.  Bond on file applied to the fine.
May serve on EMP.  May serve in Hennepin County, MN.  Start jail today at the Jackson County Jail.  Furlough granted to report by 6:00 p.m. October 6, 2015 to Hennepin County, MN.

Per Statute 343.301(g) your operating privileges for operation of Class D vehicles will require that vehicles owned and/or driven by you be equipped with an ignition interlock device.  Must install a mandatory Ignition Interlock Device when defendant obtains an occupational license or regular license.  There is a $50 ignition interlock surcharge imposed.
Added to payment plan.    Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Scott D Kistner

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt: DA Gerald Fox appears for the State. Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Poss.  Plead no contest to OWI 3rd.  Court recited the charge and possible penalties of the charge he is pleading to.  He understands.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, elements and constitutional rights with the defendant.  He understood.  Defense stipulated to a factual basis for the charge in the amended complaint.  Priors confirmed.  Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of count 1.  Joint recommendation for $600.00 fine, plus costs.  45 days jail.  May serve in Hennipen County, MN.  24 months DL revocation and IID requirement. Alcohol assessment and driver's safety plan.  Credit for 5 days served.  Defendant elected to exercise his right to allocution.  Court ordered:  $600.00 fine, plus costs. $1694.00.  Apply bond on file.   45 days jail.  Report to Jackson County jail today.  Furlough to report by 6:00 pm.  to Hennipen Co.  Credit for 5 days served.  May serve in Hennipen County, MN.  24 months DL revocation and IID requirement.  Alcohol assessment and driver's safety plan.   Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.  Pay balance of fine @ $100/mo starting 12/1/15.    Failure to pay any part of the fine and court costs will result in 30 days jail.

Received email from Attorney Poss to remove the Status on 9/21/15 for Mr Kistner as an agreement reached with DA Office.  Confirmed with DA Fox and Victim Witness Coord that ok to remove and set for plea.

Pre-trial conference at 09-02-2015 10:00 am.
Status conference at 09-21-2015 03:00 pm.

Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on the highways until properly reinstated in the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on the highways until properly reinstated in the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Poss requests lower bond to $1,000.00.  Attorney Fox does not object.  Ordered.
PTC 9/2/15 and STC 9/21/15.  Court questioned defendant on his waiver.  Court finds defendant knowingly and intelligently waived time limits.

DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in custody.  Court recited the charge and possible penalties.  Defendant understood.  Court advised defendant to contact SPD.  Defendant stated that he had already and he did not qualify.  Bond set.  AIA set for 8/10/15 at 9:30 am.
